By a vote of 8-1, the Lower Merion Board of School Directors has approved a Health and Safety Plan for reopening, under which school will start fully virtual through October 5, 2020, with a goal of a safe return to in-person instruction.

The Administration will work toward providing safe in-person orientation opportunities for students transitioning into new schools to the extent possible, and will work toward providing in-person instructional opportunities for students with identified needs.

Additionally, the District will continue to meet with local childcare providers and community stakeholders to strategize on ways to help families meet childcare needs during remote instruction.

post_text: At tonight's School Board meeting, Board President Dr. Melissa Gilbert announced the addition of the AdHoc Committee on Equity and Anti-Racism to address racism, safety and security within our schools. This committee, chaired by Board Member Shawn Mooring, will work proactively to listen to voices in our community, not only to ensure that past inequities are addressed to the extent possible, but to ensure that they are righted for the future. Other members are Lucy Klain (who co-chairs the Curriculm Committee), Peter Lee (who co-chairs Facilities) and Shayna Kalish (who co-chairs Communciations). Superintendent Copeland will serve as the Administrative liaison. The committee will begin its work in the summer and will create an action agenda for the Board.

Over the past few weeks, Bala Cynwyd Middle School Instructional Assistant Liz Miller decided to use her talents as a certified art and family consumer sciences teacher to lend a hand during the ongoing COVID-19 crisis. Due to the dearth of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), Miller realized she could put her unique skill set to use making face masks for those-in-need!

Since embarking on this endeavor, Miller has made more than 150 face masks and the orders are continuing to roll since Governor Wolf's recent mandate to wear the protective gear in public venues. Her masks have been shipped all across Pennsylvania and New Jersey and have even traveled as far as Kansas! Miller, who sews in between virtual distance learning sessions with students and colleagues, has earmarked all monetary contributions and donations she has received to help the Narberth Food Bank.

post_text: Lower Merion High School senior Philip Monos and Head Coach Nico Severini were recently invited to the Pennsylvania Soccer Coaches All-State Award Ceremony, which was held in Harrisburg, PA. Monos recorded a stellar final season with the Aces as he led the team in points with seven goals and 17 assists while helping to guide Lower Merion to an impressive regular season record of 17-0-1, a Central League title and a #11 ranking in the nation before bowing out in the round of eight in the PIAA State Tournament. For his efforts, Monos garnered Central League Most Valuable Player honors, was named to the 2020 Pennsylvania All-State and Regional All-American teams, and earned first-team honors for the Central League, Main Line Times and All-Southeastern PA. Best of luck next year Franklin & Marshall College!
